page.title: 11A GAMEKEEPER'S DAY
page.content: Mr Ireland is Head Gamekeeper for Arundel Park. He is employed by the Norfolk Estate to manage 4,500 acres between Slindon and Patching, the South Downs Way and the A27. His job is to breed and release birds for shooting. A day's shooting costs Â£200. After release the birds are still given food and water as the dry Downs provide little food. He rises at 5.30 goes to the pheasant runs and checks that the 1500 birds are warm and have food and water. He then feeds the stock partridges. After breakfast he exercises his dogs and carries out gamekeeping duties such as feeding posts and checking fox traps. He leaves one fox for the hunt. His day ends at 11pm although in the shooting season he has to patrol the park for poachers. Most damage is done by the public and their dogs.
